Description: Seven beads made of different sizes and materials. A: Fragment of a stone bead, probably original barrel-shaped, only one end is preserved. Light green stone. B: One cylindrical segmented bead made of white faience. C: Three larger disc-shaped beads made of faience with a vivid turquoise glaze. D: Two smaller disc-shaped beads made of faience, one of them light blue, the other cream-whitish.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
